intro: Gossypianthus lanuginosus, commonly known as the woolly gossypianthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gossypianthus lanuginosus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various garden conditions.
